summary: anti: We don’t know what Jon’s true feelings are towards Daenerys. Davos: I’ve noticed you staring at her good heart. Tyrion:...
body:
anti: We don’t know what Jon’s true feelings are towards Daenerys.

Davos: I’ve noticed you staring at her good heart.

Tyrion: Jon Snow is in love with you Daenerys.

anti: I mean we just cannot tell with what S7 gave us.

The show: let me narrate for you - by placing this dialogue specifically over Jon and Daenerys - that they love each other.

anti: I just do not believe that he actually loves her.

D&D: Daenerys feels herself falling for Jon, and Jon is falling for Dany.

Ramin: So let me talk about Jon and Dany’s love theme and how I couldn’t give away the love too soon.

anti: I don’t think Kit has said that Jon loves her.

Kit: When you feel THAT deeply about someone, you can’t stop it.

anti: Guess we’ll just have to wait until S8 to see you guys.

anti in S8:

Literally everyone else:

blog.name: fixaidea
blog.title: Fixa Idea
blog.description:
Fixa's virtual scrapbook. Comics, illustrations and jolly randomness. And sword fighting, and other historical martial arts. Because whyever not?

While technically not a fandom blog, you may find liberal amounts of Discworld, Tolkien, Star Wars and Les Misérables-related posts, along with history, linguistics and anything else that happens to grab my attention.

summary: Youths needed for special effects jobs
title: Youths needed for special effects jobs
body:
It is one of the UK’s most exciting and fastest growing industries.

It also employs more than 10,000 people.

Now the industry creating special effects for film and TV is encouraging young people in Northern Ireland to think about it as a career.

Schoolchildren attending an event organised by Into Film, an educational charity, at Ormeau Baths in Belfast had the chance to get advice from some special effects experts.

Catherine Mullan, who is originally from Dungiven and is now a senior animator at an Oscar-winning company, was there.

Ms Mullan works for the Moving Picture Company (MPC) who produce visual effects for TV and film.

In 2017, MPC won the Academy Award for best visual effects for its work on The Jungle Book.

‘A digital movie’

Ms Mullan said that the visual effects production on the film was extensive.

“About 800 artists worked on it across the globe, and it was a huge success for the company as the images were beautiful,” she said.

“The live action elements for the movie were shot in Los Angeles, but the live action element was mainly just one boy.

“Everything else in the movie was created digitally, on the computer, and most of that work was done in our Bangalore and London offices.

“So all of the environments that you see – all of the water, the skies and all of the talking animals – were created and animated in our London office.”

The accidental animator

Ms Mullan said that she got into working in special effects “quite by accident”.

“I discovered a university degree in Bournemouth in England, so I went across there in 1998 and studied computer animation for three years,” she said.

“After that I moved to London where I’ve been working ever since as an animator and now an animation supervisor.”

‘We need young people with different perspectives’

A number of Northern Irish companies who produce special effects were also at the event, showing their work to local schoolchildren.

The event was organised by Into Film, which promotes film education in schools.

According to its figures, over 80% of those working in special effects in the UK have a university degree.

However, Into Film’s careers manager Yen Yau said that young people did not need to specialise in media or film at university.

“We need young people coming into the industry with different perspectives, different voices and different ideas,” she said.

“What we want to get away from is that it’s about having a film or media degree.

“In our industry being good at computer science, maths or drawing is just as relevant, as for every job role there’s a different set of skills.”

Among the other companies working with schoolchildren at the Belfast event were The Third Floor, which has produced special effects for Game of Thrones, The Mill which has provided effects for Nike and Audi adverts and Belfast- based animation studio Jam Media.

Related Topics

  • Animation
  • Film
  • Belfast

Read more: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-northern-ireland-45920581

The post Youths needed for special effects jobs appeared first on Viral TV News.



from WordPress http://www.viraltvnews.com/game_of_thrones/youths-needed-for-special-effects-jobs/

tags: but really the tag should be
summary: I'm eternally amazed that people come to my posts to comment how "I aM wRoNG", "I Am DeLusIOnAl", "I don't have any point", "lol...
body:
I’m eternally amazed that people come to my posts to comment how “I aM wRoNG”, “I Am DeLusIOnAl”, “I don’t have any point”, “lol typical Jonsa” and expect me to defend my opinion to them, because… Why?

If it were just one post saying “You are stupid” - OK, you expressed your opinion (which you felt the need to come to another person’s blog to express while shitting on theirs, but ok, freedom of speech and all of that), but why do you expect me to start defending mine to you?

Like, seriously, I tried answering by telling them to move on, but they keep answering me by continuing to tell me how I aM WrOnG, expecting me to fire back with a list of reasons for why I have the opinion I have🤨

Guys/ladies, I have my opinion, you obviously already decided on yours, you obviously don’t want to know an alternative opinion, you just come to mock it - why exactly do you expect the person you mock to try and validate her opinion to you??? Like, this is a complete mystery to me. Is this something you do? Do you judge by how you react to similar things? How insecure one should be to engage in such activities?

Like, this is a complete mystery to me. Is this something you do? Do you judge by how you react to similar things? How insecure one should be to engage in such activities?

tags: it's disappointing to remember how much the show goes downhill after season 4
i'm still doing the game of thrones in review thing just without a podcast
summary: Five years later, the downfall of Robb Stark is still as brutally unbearable as it was when it first aired. It's just a shame...
body:
Five years later, the downfall of Robb Stark is still as brutally unbearable as it was when it first aired. It’s just a shame that the show never did anything narratively or thematically interesting with it. 

The only architect of the Red Wedding that ever suffers any real thematic comeuppance is Tywin. Roose Bolton is suddenly axed by Ramsay in season 5 (I think?) and Walder Frey gets a quick doing in by Arya just to tie off that plot. None of it actually matters.

In the books, the Red Wedding leads to an enormous rise in instability, criminality, and violent repression in the Riverlands (not to mention a crusade of vengeance led by a zombified Catelyn Stark). In the show, the Red Wedding is just *a shocking thing* that happened that characters sometimes talk about. It’s set up as a major thing and then it goes no where afterwards.

summary: Weirdly, I ship Sansa with Edric Dayne.  I never shipped her with anybody before (don't like any of the "romance prospects" in...
question: Weirdly, I ship Sansa with Edric Dayne.  I never shipped her with anybody before (don't like any of the "romance prospects" in her narrative).  Somebody said that they shipped her with Edric and the more I think about it the more I like this ship. The little I've seen of him I like (He seems to be a sweet, polite, nice boy and I think they will mesh well)  Wishful thinking on my part since I'm not a fan of Jon, don't like anybody else and I want to see Dorne in season 8.  What do you think?
answer:
They’re the same age which makes them 100x better than her other ships. He seems like a good person. From what I remember he broke away from Lady Stoneheart because he didn’t agree with her actions. The more I think about it, the better this ship looks.

I’m with you anon on the shipping part. I don’t really have a Sansa ship. I used to be into Sansaery but I’m indifferent to it because of Margaery having sex with an underage boy which reminded me that Sansa is much younger than her. I don’t care for Jon though I like the Jonsa fandom. Sansa x Brienne has an age gap and that spark that would draw me in doesn’t exist. Sansa x Dany has potential because of the whole enemies to friends to lovers but then again I’ve only seen soft lesbian aesthetics which I find unrealistic. Sansa x Theon is OK. I don’t know why it’s hard for me to find a Sansa ship that gives me feelings.

reblog.comment:
They’re the same age which makes them 100x better than her other ships. He seems like a good person. From what I remember he broke away from Lady Stoneheart because he didn’t agree with her actions. The more I think about it, the better this ship looks.

I’m with you anon on the shipping part. I don’t really have a Sansa ship. I used to be into Sansaery but I’m indifferent to it because of Margaery having sex with an underage boy which reminded me that Sansa is much younger than her. I don’t care for Jon though I like the Jonsa fandom. Sansa x Brienne has an age gap and that spark that would draw me in doesn’t exist. Sansa x Dany has potential because of the whole enemies to friends to lovers but then again I’ve only seen soft lesbian aesthetics which I find unrealistic. Sansa x Theon is OK. I don’t know why it’s hard for me to find a Sansa ship that gives me feelings.

trail.content_raw:
They’re the same age which makes them 100x better than her other ships. He seems like a good person. From what I remember he broke away from Lady Stoneheart because he didn’t agree with her actions. The more I think about it, the better this ship looks.

I’m with you anon on the shipping part. I don’t really have a Sansa ship. I used to be into Sansaery but I’m indifferent to it because of Margaery having sex with an underage boy which reminded me that Sansa is much younger than her. I don’t care for Jon though I like the Jonsa fandom. Sansa x Brienne has an age gap and that spark that would draw me in doesn’t exist. Sansa x Dany has potential because of the whole enemies to friends to lovers but then again I’ve only seen soft lesbian aesthetics which I find unrealistic. Sansa x Theon is OK. I don’t know why it’s hard for me to find a Sansa ship that gives me feelings.
trail.content:
They’re the same age which makes them 100x better than her other ships. He seems like a good person. From what I remember he broke away from Lady Stoneheart because he didn’t agree with her actions. The more I think about it, the better this ship looks.

I’m with you anon on the shipping part. I don’t really have a Sansa ship. I used to be into Sansaery but I’m indifferent to it because of Margaery having sex with an underage boy which reminded me that Sansa is much younger than her. I don’t care for Jon though I like the Jonsa fandom. Sansa x Brienne has an age gap and that spark that would draw me in doesn’t exist. Sansa x Dany has potential because of the whole enemies to friends to lovers but then again I’ve only seen soft lesbian aesthetics which I find unrealistic. Sansa x Theon is OK. title: [Spoilers] Just had an interesting thought.
body:
Please correct me if I’m wrong.

The children used dragon glass to create the first WW correct? Yes.

What I’m confused about is how did they get dragon glass in Westreros when the Targaryans weren’t in the picture yet, and why we’re their paintings in the cave at dragon stone when the long Night happened before the Targaryans moved there?

Could it be that all of the history is wrong and the Targaryans have more to do with the WW than we think?

Like I said correct me of I’m wrong, or if there is an explanation. I am working on a theory for the end game and need to fact check.



Source: https://ift.tt/2RAi9Um

blog.name: mibbacreativewriting
blog.title: Mibba
blog.description: Mibba is a creative writing site designed for authors to share their stories, poems and articles and gain feedback from a growing audience.

title: Luke
body:
“Because no one remembers the nights they got enough sleep.”

it happens all the time.

I met Luke two years ago at a party. My boyfriend, whom I assumed I’d be together with forever, had cheated on me and dumped me. My best friend had dragged me out to her brother’s college frat party…

Read more…
